adjectives.description: feliform (comparative more feliform, superlative most feliform)

entries.meaning: Resembling a cat; applied to member of the Feliformia, a suborder within the order Carnivora consisting of cat-like carnivorans, including cats (large and small), hyenas, mongooses, civets, etc.
Any carnivore of the suborder Feliformia, which are regarded as cat-like.
examples: However, when extinct genera are included, caniforms far outnumber feliforms, with 244 extinct caniform genera to 76 extinct feliform genera, if nimravids are included with feliforms (McKenna and Bell, 1997).
